questionTitle: Which of the following product migrate files from one datastore to another datastore?
questionExplanation: Virtual machine uses the datastore continues to run.

questionOption1: A part of the DRS called the distributed power management (DPM) module can manage the power consumption of systems
questionOption2: DMS monitors network connections, provides firewall services, and enables the use of third-party switches
questionOption3: Physical computers can be standalone hosts or a set of clustered systems
questionExplanation: DVS has the capability to maintain a network runtime state for virtual machines as they are migrated from one physical system to another.

questionTitle: ________ virtualization abstracts networking hardware and software into a virtual network that can be managed.
questionExplanation: The key feature that makes virtual infrastructure so appealing for organizations implementing a cloud computing solution is flexibility.

questionTitle: Which of the following visualization is most commonly achieved through a mapping mechanism where a logical storage address is translated into a physical storage address?
questionExplanation: Block-based storage such as those used in SANs use a feature called a Logical Unit Identifier (LUN) with specific addresses stored in the form of an offset called the Logical Block Address (LBA).

questionOption1: A virtual network can create virtual network interfaces
questionOption2: Instantiating a virtual machine is a very slow process
questionOption3: You can make machine images of systems in the configuration that you want to deploy or take snapshots of working virtual machines
questionExplanation: Instantiating a virtual machine is a very fast process, typically only a few seconds in length.

questionTitle: A _______ image makes a copy or a clone of the entire computer system inside a single container such as a file.
questionExplanation: The system imaging program is used to make this image and can be used later to restore a system image.

questionTitle: Which of the following is an open standard for storing a system image?
questionExplanation: OVF stands for the pen Virtualization Format.

questionTitle: _________ is used by Amazon Web Services to store copies of a virtual machine.
questionExplanation: AMI stands for Amazon Machine Image.

questionTitle: AMI imaging service is provided by Amazon for ______________
questionExplanation: An AMI can be for public use under a free distribution license, for pay-per-use with operating systems such as Windows, or shared by an EC2 user with other users who are given the privilege of access.

questionTitle: Which of the following runs on Xen Hypervisor?
questionExplanation: The term virtual appliance is meant to differentiate the software image from an operating virtual machine.
